summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Leslie Wexner on July 5, 2019, commanding his appearance before a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York on July 24, 2019, to testify and produce documents regarding alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to maintain confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents in connection with an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy laws.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Geoffrey S. Berman is the United States Attorney who signed the subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a grand jury subpoena to Wexner, compelling his testimony and document production in a federal criminal investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance of Leslie Wexner
events.description: Leslie Wexner is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and provide evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, commanding Leslie Wexner's appearance and document production.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Leslie Wexner, a prominent businessman, was subpoenaed to testify before a federal grand jury investigating alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421-2423 (transportation for prostitution, coercion, and minors), and 371 (conspiracy).

The subpoena, issued on July 5, 2019, commanded Wexner's appearance on July 24, 2019, and included a request to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the subpoena's existence to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The document explicitly states that failure to comply constitutes contempt of court and subjects the recipient to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The investigation was being conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York under then-U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.
